column1: There’s still work to do to dig out from under #COVID19 but the US Q3 #GDP report is great news for our recovering economy and @realdonaldtrump’s pro-growth economic policies.

Honored to be designated a @nfib "Guardian of Small Business." Small business owners and those they employ have my admiration and solid support especially as we work to overcome the #COVID19 pandemic. @nfib_ms

The Senate Dems have racked up a perfect four-for-four record of stopping the delivery of new #COVID19 relief. Unfortunately their perfect record denies the citizens of MS and this great country a new round of PPP unemployment benefits money for vaccines and testing and more.

PPP successfully kept hard-hit small businesses and their employees afloat as the #coronavirus battered our economy.  It’s a shame that Senate Dems continue to hurt the American people instead of getting real help out the door right now.

The “all-or-nothing” act Speaker Pelosi and Senate Dems have clung to has only hurt Americans. The Minority Leader tried to adjourn the Senate last night sans any #COVID19 relief. We’re back in D.C. to get things done. We are here to offer actual help to Mississippians. https://t.co/4TmQkua3b6

We must work together on #COVID19 relief. Defunding the police & rewriting election laws have zilch to do w/ the current crisis. Re-upping #PPP aid to help schools reopen safely & increased treatment/vaccine resources on the other hand have lots to do w/ helping Americans.

Fisheries surveys critical to @msgulfcoast economies were suspended this year due to #COVID19. @NOAA should take action now to ensure the surveys can take place in 2021 so MS coastal communities can get this industry back on track. @SenatorRogerWicker

Getting a flu shot is important every year but it’s especially important this year with #COVID19. Got my flu shot at @Walgreens this morning and I hope my fellow Mississippians will do their part to protect themselves & their communities by getting vaccinated against the #flu.

Like so many in MS and across the USA and world I am praying for a swift recovery for @realdonaldtrump and @FLOTUS as they fight #COVID19. The American people stand strong with you. May God continue to bless you and everyone affected by the #coronavirus. https://t.co/Wahzd9wNZd

Last night the Senate passed & @realdonaldtrump signed a stopgap funding bill to maintain fed. programs w/out disruptions as families & communities work through #COVID19. Hopeful the bipartisan cooperation that went into this will keep for negotiations in FY21 approps bills.

Particularly during our current economic hardships due to #COVID19 it’s important to find ways to tear down roadblocks that keep women and minorities from reentering the #STEM workforce. Read more about @SenJackyRosen’s and my bill to address that:

.@SenateGOP offered 2 #COVID19 relief bills over the past 2 months both blocked by Democrats. Time lost while they could have worked with us to boost healthcare aid the jobless & help schools open safely. Looks like now they are starting to see consequences of their inaction.

Was great chatting with @msbankers this morning. So disappointing Democrats in Congress continue to hold up new #COVID19 relief including more #PPP to help #SmallBusinesses and save jobs. We’ll keep working to get it done. https://t.co/MpYF9sNjhB

MS businesses are beginning to bounce back from #COVID19 downturn much the same way we grew under @HaleyBarbour's leadership after Katrina. Former Gov Barbour shared insights with Senators today at @RoyBlunt’s Coffee and Conversation. Good stuff! https://t.co/gXavVpWivD

After MS veterans told me about a lack of rapid #COVID19 testing at the Armed Forces Retirement Home in @CityofGulfport I wrote to @DLAMIL requesting that be rectified. Grateful for the quick turn-around and pleased our veterans will benefit. Read more here:

Farmers & ranchers have experienced depressed prices catastrophic flooding market disruptions & now #COVID19. With the end of the fiscal year fast approaching we must ensure important @USDA ag/conservation programs do not come to a screeching halt on Oct. 1.

Access to healthcare is always more challenging in rural America. @HHSGov @CDCgov @DeptofDefense & other agencies working with states to plan for potential #COVID19vaccine distribution to rural America later this year.
My latest e-newsletter which includes highlights of some of my work with Mississippians as we work our way through the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic:

There are many ways we can safely pay our respects to those who lost their lives on #September11 amidst #COVID19. Join @NLEOMF tomorrow on Facebook live to honor law enforcement officers who gave their lives that day. https://t.co/Kbh3jlk5gb https://t.co/8gqlDGWOID

Here we go again. Dems block a #COVID19 relief bill with *billions* for school safety unemployment benefits liability protection & much more. Why? They want to cling to their demands for cannabis research checks for illegal immigrants & tax cuts for blue state millionaires. https://t.co/A6ZVfsmqju

Financial hardship caused by #COVID19 puts some at risk of homelessness which could mean greater risk of spreading #coronavirus. @HUDgov sending $18.7M in additional #CARESAct CDBG funding to help address housing & other hardships caused by the pandemic.

In addition to providing for kids jobs and healthcare this plan would also provide $20B of additional farm assistance and $500M in direct federal assistance for fisheries which would be crucial for MS farmers fishers and producers as they continue to navigate #COVID19.

When the aviation industry returns to pre- #COVID19 levels the need for pilots and technicians will be in even more demand. The @FAANews pilot education and aviation technician programs received full funding in FY20. It’s time to be proactive and implement them.

Great news for @PascagoulaCity @msgulfcoast: Just under $8M in #CARESAct funding to the MS Coast Transit Authority for transit services in Jackson County throughout #COVID19. Workers and residents rely on this transportation & I’m grateful it will continue to be provided for them

Great news: Just this morning @TVAnews Board approved a special $200M #Pandemic Relief Credit to help communities recover economically. Wonderful to see TVA using its resources to deliver continued support for Mississippians & other customers throughout #COVID19. Read more:

Thank you @CMSgov @SeemaCMS  and @realdonaldtrump for this new #RuralCrosswalk. This added flexibility will be a huge help to rural healthcare providers in the fight against #COVID19 and your continued support goes a long way for Mississippi. https://t.co/nsA4s8rAyS.

Children will continue to need federal nutrition support whether their schools are open or offering online courses. @USDA has adapted child nutrition policies to meet the need and that flexibility should continue as we work our way through #COVID19. @SecretarySonny @SenateAgGOP

.@USDA will make farm-raised catfish producers eligible for direct relief for losses associated with #COVID19. This is great news for MS catfish producers who have suffered declining sales because of #coronavirus. Grateful to @SecretarySonny for addressing this need. @usdafsa

$3.5M going to 10 MS universities/community colleges for student support services. @usedgov funding will help students stay on top of their studies which will be especially important as #COVID19 affects campus life for the foreseeable future. @MSPublicUniv
In every of corner our state Mississippians are heroically showing up to aid their neighbors during this #pandemic. Had a chance to thank our #COVID19 heroes today.

For the first time @USDA is purchasing MS-produced shrimp to distribute to food banks and nonprofits addressing some #COVID19 economic challenges. Grateful to @SecSonny for recognizing how this purchase decision will help an important @msgulfcoast industry & those in need.

Rural hospitals have been significantly affected by #COVID19. Let’s not put them in a position of having to choose between rural physician training programs or staying open. I joined in asking @HHSGov to release #coronavirus emergency funding to help them.
Happy #NationalInternDay to my small but dedicated summer intern class! #COVID19 made for an unusual summer session but my staff and I were so appreciative of their good work. https://t.co/f0y9tQzzHL
Was wonderful to sit down with @usedgov @BetsyDeVosED to discuss how to best serve students and educators during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/l7O3QKO4UC

The #COVID19 trajectory indicates that MS frontline workers first responders and citizens will need substantial and sustained supplies of PPE. $4.39M from @FEMA supports @msema’s disaster response efforts. @SenatorWicker

Great to see @nationalguardMS working with @msdh to process #COVID19 tests. The National Guard is playing an important role in providing manpower and support as our state works to overcome the #coronavirus. Watch here: https://t.co/vvfzHN0G8P

The HEALS Act represents a responsible realistic plan to help schools workers the economy and importantly frontline caregivers. Americans want and need Congress to work together to continue the #COVID19 fight. More on the appropriations portion below:

Overcoming #COVID19 public health economic and social challenges will take hard work. #CORPSAct will empower Americans to help make communities stronger & healthier for everyone. @AmeriCorps @NationalService

Mississippians can’t wait until Democrats decide to put the American people over politics. A #COVID19 vaccine & other medications can’t do any good when people can’t afford them. @ChuckGrassley’s Prescription Drug Pricing Reduction Act should be in the next relief package.

#COVID19 is without a doubt raising anxiety among Mississippians which can create critical situations for those already dealing with mental health or substance abuse issues. The @HHSgov has awarded $1.3M to address these issues in to our state. @MSUExtService

It’s an honor to be recognized as a 2020 #MedicareAdvantage Congressional Supporter by @BMAlliance. Affordable healthcare is more important than ever during the #COVID19 crisis and I will continue to work hard to keep it that way. Learn more below:

ICYMI: @CommerceGov has given Mississippi small businesses another lifeline to respond to #COVID19 by recapitalizing revolving loan funds that serve almost 60 counties across the state. Grateful to @realdonaldtrump @SecretaryRoss for this strong investment in our great state. https://t.co/GsqK0VZ6bH
Are you using hand sanitizer correctly? Test your knowledge about the appropriate use of hand sanitizer with this @FDA hand sanitizer quiz. #COVID19 https://t.co/8GpsakPMy5 https://t.co/wv7lZFIWXp

Mississippi #veterans: @VAVetBenefits is hosting a Tele-Townhall at 4pmCT today! @DeptVetAffairs Under Sec. Paul Lawrence will give an update on VBA programs: Solid Start Blue Water Navy & #COVID19 response. Join the discussion: 833-380-0417 https://t.co/xMWtMgXw9u

I joined @SenBillCassidy & others asking @HHSGov @CMSGov for details on sustaining expanded #telehealth even after #COVID19. It has proven too valuable to reduce access especially for rural Mississippians. @UMMCTelehealth is a national leader. https://t.co/cQP7kfXZwB https://t.co/2pGry8vwqH

#COVID19 has only added to Mississippian’s anxieties around skyrocketing prescription drug prices. If we’re serious about helping Americans @ChuckGrassley’s bill to address these issues should be an immediate priority.

#COVID19 increases in rural Mississippi and USA put greater hardships on providers. @Sen_JoeManchin & I continue to push @HHSgov for definite 20% set aside for rural providers. w/ @SenatorWicker @RepTrentKelly @RepMichaelGuest

.@FAANews  grants $15.56M to improve 22 MS airports with #CARESAct funding added to help offset the #COVID19 financial hits to our cities and counties. @SenatorWicker  https://t.co/pJy2PANiKC https://t.co/K7YLKzj12K

With #coronavirus cases rising and the #July4th holiday here it’s important we do our part to protect ourselves & fellow Mississippians. This @NIST video demonstrates how wearing a mask reduces the potential spread of #COVID19. Take a look. https://t.co/2vhxDkoZrp

Big Day for the #USA! #USMCA takes effect bringing benefits for American manufacturers farmers businesses & workers. Builds on @realDonaldTrump's America first commitment & can help us build a stronger post-#COVID19 economy. https://t.co/486WmYapmq

Appreciate @UMMCnews working to find good out of the bad associated with #COVID19. Let’s continue working to avoid new cases. But if you’ve had the #coronavirus learn more about how you might be able to help. @msdh #InThisTogether https://t.co/3OaIZMfQGr

A strong health workforce is more necessary than ever as #COVID19 is showing us.  The $1.27 in @HHSGov @HRSAgov funds going to @UMMCnews and @USMGoldenEagles will fortify these already very established programs.

#COVID19 is helping prove the benefits of telehealth services. We can’t allow #Medicare clawback demands to stunt progress. @SenAngusKing & I have introduced legislation to shield rural clinics & federally qualified health centers from those costs throughout the #pandemic. @msdh

National service programs have established strong records for providing critical assistance in times of crisis. That’s why I helped introduce the #CORPSAct which would double the # of @AmeriCorps positions this year to help folks overcome hardships caused by #COVID19.
We must remain wary of #COVID19 as MS reopens. This @CDC Resuming Business Toolkit is useful in going about our business more safely. https://t.co/sMM4Xo8ToP

.@HHSGov awards $219M in #CARESAct funding to support MS safety net hospitals serving Medicare and other vulnerable patients. I will continue working to help these facilities remain open and survive the #COVID19 health crisis.

More work to be done but May #jobsreport offers a glimmer of hope for safely reopening MS & nation for business. Thankfully our @realdonaldtrump economy was healthy before #COVID19 and we may bounce back faster than expected! https://t.co/cDVJ6c0Jlt

#COVID19 exposed the risks of lacking a strong national critical medical supply stockpile. I’m cosponsoring legislation with @SenThomTillis @SenatorBennet to improve and renew the Strategic National Stockpile. Read more: https://t.co/eVNAsYq1c1

MS rural health providers need assured access to #COVID19 resources as the pandemic affects their ability to survive financially. @Sen_JoeManchin @lisamurkowski & I have a bill to require 20 percent set-aside. Read more.

#COVID19 stress on state county & city budgets is made worse for those hit by disasters. I’ve introduced a bill to eliminate the @FEMA cost-share for 2020 federal disaster declarations. This plan builds on the #SMARTAct bill from earlier this week. @MSEMA https://t.co/eko9WX8GZf https://t.co/QLvu2fCdJu
.@TheJusticeDept is directing $6M in #CARESAct funding to MS law enforcement entities to help offset costs sustained to fight #COVID19. May 29 deadline for additional grants drawing near. @MissDPS
Great to see the @USDA Farmers to Families Food Box Program is getting food to people in need during the #COVID19 outbreak. https://t.co/CeQCP7UabW https://t.co/4jFRPG0Sqk

.@MSSeafood is a huge economic driver on the @msgulfcoast. Demand has dropped with #COVID19 shuttering restaurants. @SenatorWicker @CongPalazzo & I are asking @USDA @SecretarySonny to buy MS seafood to help sustain those in need.

I’m hearing from MS cities and counties about their hardships as #COVID19 costs pile up. A responsible bipartisan $500B #SMARTFund bill would give cities counties and states help to avoid mass layoffs and essential service lapses. @SenBillCassidy @SenatorMenendez

Many college-level students who work a night job to help pay for classes are out of work due to #COVID19. It’s good to see Mississippi universities and colleges working to make #CARESAct assistance available to them. https://t.co/abuZhfBXqI

#COVID19 Economic Impact Payments are helping Mississippians every day. For remaining direct deposit option register before noon Eastern tomorrow at https://t.co/bIRiBK7eiU @IRSnews https://t.co/cIfwtm2Fyl

China should be held accountable for its part in the #COVID19Pandemic. The world needs answers on how this all started & spread misery across the globe. If they refuse to comply this legislation would authorize @realdonaldtrump to impose sanctions. https://t.co/ce31KqMUYx https://t.co/KCTE2TFcpO

Merchants Foodservices of Hattiesburg gets a $10.3M @USDA contract to package surplus foodstuffs to help those in need. It’s part of @realdonaldtrump & @SecretarySonny plan to help #agriculture and rural America fight #COVID19. https://t.co/CeQCP7CyNm https://t.co/7EQ0FrQY6o

.@SBAgov continues to make #PPP loans. MS small businesses are participating with significant cooperation by our banks to help businesses navigate and utilize this #COVID19 jobs-saving program.  @renasant   #InThisTogether https://t.co/dkuOp65rvM
MS will receive $1.53M in #CARES Act fishery disaster relief funds from @CommerceGov. This will help to begin addressing #COVID19 economic harm. https://t.co/Hj6JPxdbIc

An additional $6.72M from @HHSGov is going to 20 MS Community Health Centers to support their #COVID19 testing capabilities. @CHCsofMS Details on MS grantees: https://t.co/HiDefwdPbe https://t.co/8mzDLEVFPI

On #NationalNursesDay we honor and thank our front-line warriors in the #COVID19 fight. If you know a nurse reach out to them today to let them know just how appreciated they are. @UMMCnews @mnanurses https://t.co/9P1Z9cMrkQ

Very good work by @fema to deliver #PPE to Mississippi for distribution by @MSEMA @nationalguardMS! Thank you @realdonaldtrump for your leadership to see that our front-line heroes have what they need to treat #COVID19 patients. #InThisTogether https://t.co/oGfL9bGSqM

If you’re an eligible MS ag producer/business hit hard by #COVID19 consider applying for @SBAgov Economic Injury Disaster Loan assistance. More info here: https://t.co/Ilo02SBaj6 https://t.co/CESK8DCrCh

We must be diligent to ensure #COVID19 pandemic isn’t used to infringe on our constitutional Second Amendment rights whether that means wrongly denying @sbagov relief for law-abiding #firearms businesses or undue background check delays. #2A Read more: https://t.co/a59ytoysPz https://t.co/EeZtBD3cZm

The @USDA will purchase $30M in surplus catfish. Since #COVID19 has severely depressed the market its good news for MS producers/processors that @SecretarySonny has directed the USDA to support American #ag. https://t.co/Qcxk5Whe4V https://t.co/cmcWfKgWnu

If your kids are getting #COVIDー19 cabin fever there is no reason they can’t go outside and play so long as everyone takes proper precautions. Family bike rides are a great choice and be sure to set a good example: helmets for everyone! @safekids https://t.co/87lT4eDbGE

A lot of #COVID19 aid is based on Mississippi’s 2010 Census response. Shows why responding to the 2020 Census is important. If you haven’t done so during the #quarantine take a few minutes to fill out your #Census2020 form. ➡️ https://t.co/UpZng7Ekq0 https://t.co/i8prx8XPn2

THANK YOU to every last Mississippian and American doing your part to ensure our nation’s recovery. It is because of you that we will defeat this invisible enemy. #InThisTogether #COVID19 https://t.co/SL3RDQeOmu

Thank you @tatereeves for inviting @SenatorWicker and I to today’s #COVID19 briefing. I appreciate the opportunity to update Mississippians on our mutual efforts to help our state fight the pandemic. #InThisTogether  https://t.co/fSU3KcJg1S

#Telehealth is proving vital during the #COVID19Pandemic. @Sen_JoeManchin @SenatorShaheen @JerryMoran & I lead an effort to have @HHSGov @CMSGov increase #Medicare payments for ‘audio-only’ telehealth services in areas without broadband service. https://t.co/cctvRmHYZF https://t.co/0TTvddkK4y

#COVID19 doesn’t eliminate the need for necessary infrastructure upgrades at local MS airports. @SenatorWicker & I announce $10.45M @FAANews grants to 13 MS airports to help make necessary upgrades to improve safety and efficiency. https://t.co/pnmM1WHzEl https://t.co/0LTqLjYuql

If you’re eligible for a #COVID19 Economic Impact Payment and haven’t received it you can check the status of your payment at enhanced @IRSnews site here. https://t.co/2SPyzpLJls https://t.co/vB1EkNwTMf

The @USTreasury is acting to make small public hospitals eligible for @SBAgov #PPP loans. This can help ensure the survival of these facilities for rural citizens during the #COVID19Pandemic. @JerryMoran & I pushed for this earlier this month. Read here. https://t.co/GLIKzQuQlG https://t.co/ltNPZHVhWB
Much needed help for MS small businesses/health providers is on its way to @realdonaldtrump today. #PaycheckProtectionProgram #COVID19 https://t.co/XkZpp3Me2r https://t.co/GL8RZ3OEHz

MS will receive more than $6.5 million from the @CDCgov to build its #COVID19 testing contact tracing and containment capacities as we take steps to safely #OpenUpAmerica. https://t.co/qhjo9TKxiU https://t.co/mjO1tlJAhQ

I’m asking @US_FDA Commissioner @SteveFDA to use emergency authority to review @UMMCnews Dr. Charles Robertson’s innovative ventilator which could offer hospitals life-saving ventilator options at a low cost. #COVID19  https://t.co/oG4AFEaaou https://t.co/uDkjNYW0B0
Manufactures across Mississippi large and small are doing their part in the fight against #COVID19 and to keep our economy going. Thank you! @MSManufacturers  #InThisTogether https://t.co/TQNQooMXkO

The longer the #COVID19 economic shutdown the greater the harm to workers and small businesses. New relief bill offers new funding for #PaycheckProtectionProgram as we work to safely reopen MS and the nation. https://t.co/XkZpp43Pr1 https://t.co/i8FU3ckKss

The recent storms have devastated MS ag producers at an already trying time due to #COVID19. Fortunately @USDA  disaster programs offer help. Read more: https://t.co/NcC1PKwz6x https://t.co/sxPIP0ToGZ

Grateful to @realdonaldtrump and @SecretarySonny for @USDA Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to help ag producers rural America during this #COVID19 pandemic. MS can benefit with its implementation.   https://t.co/ttwlUXAvXK https://t.co/usrUeUMzZQ

Today @SBAgov announced officially that #PaycheckProtectionProgram is out of funds. Every Senate Republican was ready to act today but Democrats won’t let us do more now to help workers & small businesses hurt by #COVID19 shutdowns. https://t.co/uW54fxrHx7
Rural hospitals are key to our #COVID19 response in Mississippi. I am working to see that these hospitals receive the resources they need to stay in the fight. https://t.co/TY3ddEzKQp

Democrats must stop blocking new #PaycheckProtectionProgram funding. MS small businesses should still apply with @SBAgov and know that I’ll push for resources to support this #COVID19 relief program. Visit https://t.co/sz1GrZ8B1F COVID-19 page for more info. https://t.co/mY3iOEKdFc

The Easter tornadoes compound the emergencies facing Mississippians. We’ll overcome both the storms & #COVID19 with faith cooperation & strength. Appreciate being with @TateReeves @RepMichaelGuest @MSEMA to assess damage. https://t.co/jB7zh2xYwX

Dozens of MS airports will share $73M in CARES Act coronavirus response funding. Continued operation in our airports is important for public safety and our economic recovery after #COVID19.  With @SenatorWicker   https://t.co/0PgVYRXVB6 https://t.co/SUhCirvNZH

With hospitals pushed to their limits by #COVID19 we should minimize not increase unrelated pressures on health care providers. @boblatta & I lead an effort to urge @SteveFDA not to let up on REMS abortion drugs restrictions during the crisis. https://t.co/jSUpCIz5jc @SBAList https://t.co/yk3mxJW2P7

#ICYMI – I joined the effort to push for a global ban on wet markets. It’s clear these are breeding grounds for the disastrous diseases that kill tens of thousands of people around the world.  #COVID19 is just the latest and most severe example. https://t.co/63137SGt7y https://t.co/U7SSIsmADF

Good news:  MS healthcare providers are receiving an initial $374 million to cover costs associated with treating #COVID19 cases. This money will help see that hospital can continue to treat patients without taking a big financial hit. https://t.co/cacHb55FN7 https://t.co/99QeZrpnMM

All aspects of the domestic aquaculture industry have been severely affected by #COVID19. @JohnBoozman @SenatorWicker @SenTomCotton and I asked @USDA @SecretarySonny to support catfish farmers with direct #CARESAct funding. https://t.co/9ZeUEuY52w https://t.co/kyfGtHnTo7

Even as we fight #COVID19 crisis Mississippians in the Yazoo Backwater Area fight a third consecutive year of catastrophic flooding with continued harm to wildlife & the environment. #FinishThePumps https://t.co/XMSR7s2iaa https://t.co/ME7D3hNpIH

Financial hardships for rural hospitals accelerated with #COVID19. @Sen_JoeManchin & I lead a bipartisan effort to have @SecAzar distribute immediate help to rural providers through the CARES Act.  https://t.co/NSAKeg1nA5 https://t.co/Oz7BaQsi5w

Congress intended states & local governments to have flexibility in using #COVID19 emergency relief funds. @SenatorWicker & I joined the effort to ensure fairness w/out red tape for Miss. https://t.co/dOZ77AeQxi https://t.co/KP79FcO54m

Our nation is facing shortages of ventilators amid the #COVID19Pandemic so Dr. Charles Robertson of @UMMCnews started making his own. This is the kind of innovation that can help save lives. Read more here: https://t.co/3gWNb5dxRt

Mississippi community health centers are on the front lines of the #COVID19Pandemic. @HRSAgov is providing $17.2 million to 19 centers in MS to support their efforts to care for #coronavirus patients. @CHCAMS https://t.co/U4PjLEALc1 https://t.co/MeAsQFiFD4

Thank you @realdonaldtrump for approving @tatereeves major disaster declaration request for Mississippi. @FEMA assistance and other federal funds will help Mississippians fight and recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/eUAJaPtTAS

ICYMI I’m part of a bipartisan push to have @HHSGov & @CMSGov to find ways to protect Medicare beneficiaries in high-risk settings and ensure safe access to care as we combat #COVID19. @SenatorTimScott @MarkWarner https://t.co/XG2KJgxvlE https://t.co/cozdEWYjpE

#COVID19 cannot be allowed to threaten our national security or the industries that support it. I'm pleased the  @USNavy is awarding a $1.5B contract to @HIIndustries to build a new LPD for the Navy & @USMC. Thank you MS Shipbuilders for your great work. https://t.co/9N0mmqpKZZ https://t.co/hjZDrwOImj

Mississippians can be proud of how our universities are harnessing their capabilities to help fight #COVID19. Keep up the good work @msstate @MSUEngineering High Voltage Lab. @MaroonResearch https://t.co/HVleciwMFU
As @USTreasury prepares to distribute #CARESAct stimulus recovery checks beware of scams. Here’s what to look out for: https://t.co/9EqgRd0ztB #COVID19 https://t.co/gb7Qj0PaHU https://t.co/9mJyJDE2HA

Governor @tatereeves’s shelter-in-place order will save lives. For the safety of all Mississippians it is critical to remain at home while we fight #COVID19.  This will not be easy but together we can slow the spread. #WereAllinThisTogether #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/ooOGCeBL5e
.@realdonaldtrump and his administration are suspending a good number of federal rules and regulations to aid in the fight against #COVID19. Read more below. https://t.co/KtWrbitM6h

Federal agencies are now working to implement the CARES Act and its #COVID19 relief for families small businesses and our stressed health care system. Visit my website for helpful agency-by-agency links: https://t.co/fyHhATqGCs https://t.co/5DhGPHH2Bh

Whether it’s donating or volunteering there are ways we can help fight against #COVID19. @FEMA has good information on how you can pitch in. Visit: https://t.co/BNRXQr25qZ #WereAllInThisTogether #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/sBiv9SEHwp
Pleased TVA will help local power companies whose customers may have trouble paying their power bills because of the #COVID19 outbreak.  We’re all In this together. https://t.co/9Qm63qJGGV

With all the concerns regarding coronavirus the good news is pregnant mothers don’t appear to be at higher risk for #coronavirus. Mothers infected with #COVID19 deliver live healthy babies. #CHOOSEHOPE Learn more 👉 https://t.co/DiM6Lvsqnr https://t.co/Hg8NF1qa1f

On a broader scale @DeptVetAffairs is looking for retired physicians nurses pharmacists lab techs respiratory therapists & other medical professionals to join the #COVID19 fight. #BeThere  Learn more: https://t.co/j3AfviSlhp

The call is going out for people with medical training to join the battle against #COVID19. @Jacksonvamc is accepting nursing position applications for immediate hire. Join a Facebook Live Event today @ 2:00pm CT or submit your resume to sonia.brown-frazier@va.gov

The CARES Act is all about alleviating human suffering. It is not perfect and may require fine-tuning but it is what the people of Mississippi and this country need in these unprecedented times. #COVID19 https://t.co/xgb4X31Plp https://t.co/X7uRYQPOS3
It is heartening and inspiring to see Mississippians and people across the country doing what they can to help overcome #COVID19.  We are truly all in this together. https://t.co/5wPxvKlaAg
